actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from OMB; U.S. Postal Service.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from U.S. Postal Service.
Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services. Hearings held.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from Postal Rate Commission.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Stevens favorably with amendments. With written report No. 97-258.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 354.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service, Post Office, and General Services

official_title: A bill to amend Title 39 of the United States Code to require that any extension of the Zip Code be part of a voluntary service option with a reduced rate.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Governmental Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 97-258) Prohibits the United States Postal Service from requiring the inclusion of a ZIP code in the address of any piece of mail, except as a condition for mailing at a special reduced rate. Prohibits an individual from discriminating against any person with respect to the issuance or use of a credit card on the basis of that person's ZIP code.

titles.title: A bill to amend Title 39 of the United States Code to require that any extension of the Zip Code be part of a voluntary service option with a reduced rate.
